extendedIngredients.name: sharp cheddar cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1¾ cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese - low fat

extendedIngredients.name: winter squash
extendedIngredients.originalString: 12 ounces cooked winter squash puree - thawed if frozen

recipes.title: Stovetop Mac and Cheese with Winter Squash

winePairing.pairingText: Lambrusco, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are my top picks for Macaroni and Cheese. With rich, cheesy mac & cheese you'll want to cleanse the palate with something crisp and acidic. We recommend Chenin Blanc, Riesling, or dry Lambrusco if you're in the mood for a red. You could try Cleto Chiarli Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Amabile. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Cleto Chiarli Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Amabile
productMatches.description: A semi-sweet wine of an intense red color. The wine has very fruity aromas and all the grape fragrances can be felt. Lively and fading bubbles are of a marked rose color. Its smoothness makes it surprisingly pleasant, though avoiding excesses. A captivating wine.Apart form being an good companion for traditional cuisinefrom Emilia, it is also indicated as an accompaniment to desserts.

recipes.instructions: Cook pasta in salty water according to package instructions reducing the cook time by 1 minute to ensure al dente pasta; set aside.In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1-2 minutes whisking frequently.Pour in milk, broth, dry mustard, smoked paprika, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil then reduce to low. Whisk constantly until sauce begins to thicken.Stir in winter squash and shredded cheese. Mix until melted, about 2-3 minutes. Check for seasoning and adjust accordingly.Add reserved shells to the pot and stir until noodles are evenly coated.Serve immediately.

steps.step: Cook pasta in salty water according to package instructions reducing the cook time by 1 minute to ensure al dente pasta; set aside.In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat.
Whisk in flour and cook for 1-2 minutes whisking frequently.
Pour in milk, broth, dry mustard, smoked paprika, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil then reduce to low.
Whisk constantly until sauce begins to thicken.Stir in winter squash and shredded cheese.
Mix until melted, about 2-3 minutes. Check for seasoning and adjust accordingly.
Add reserved shells to the pot and stir until noodles are evenly coated.
